item.title: How Google‚Äôs AI can help transform health professions education
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
Google‚Äôs AI is shaping the future of health professions education. üåç With a projected shortage of over 11 million healthcare workers by 2030, AI tools are being explored to enhance medical learning. Two studies reveal how Google‚Äôs AI models can serve as personalized learning aids for medical students. The first study focused on using generative AI to support clinical reasoning, while the second assessed LearnLM, an AI model tailored for education. Results show strong interest in AI that‚Ä¶

Source: Google Research

item.title: A scalable framework for evaluating health language models
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
Introducing a new framework for evaluating health language models! üè• This adaptive methodology improves efficiency and inter-rater reliability, reducing the reliance on costly human experts. By using simple boolean questions, it streamlines the evaluation process for complex health queries. The framework focuses on personalized health data and is validated in the metabolic health domain, covering conditions like diabetes and obesity. Learn more about this innovative approach! üîçü§ñ #HealthTech‚Ä¶

Source: Google Research

Category: educational

item.title: From massive models to mobile magic: The tech behind YouTube real-time generative AI effects
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
YouTube is enhancing user experience on mobile with real-time generative AI effects. üì±‚ú® By utilizing knowledge distillation and MediaPipe, YouTube has developed a solution to deliver over 20 effects directly on creators‚Äô phones. This process involves creating smaller, efficient models tailored for specific tasks, allowing for seamless video processing. These advancements make features like cartoon style transfer not only possible but also fun and interactive for creators on YouTube Shorts. üé®üé•‚Ä¶

item.title: Securing private data at scale with differentially private partition selection
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üîí New algorithms are advancing user privacy in data sharing through differentially private partition selection. This approach allows for safe sharing of large datasets, crucial for AI and machine learning innovation. It ensures individual contributions remain confidential by adding controlled noise during selection. Parallel algorithms enhance efficiency, enabling the processing of vast datasets while maintaining robust privacy guarantees. Explore more in the publication ‚ÄúScalable Private‚Ä¶

Source: Google Research
Author: Unknown
Category: security_compliance

item.title: Beyond billion-parameter burdens: Unlocking data synthesis with a conditional generator
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
Unlocking data synthesis in AI just got easier! üåê A new algorithm, CTCL, enables the generation of synthetic data while preserving privacy, using a lightweight 140 million parameter model. This approach avoids the complexities of fine-tuning billion-scale models, making it accessible for resource-constrained applications. CTCL conditions data on topic information, ensuring better topic distribution matching. It also allows for unlimited synthetic data generation without additional privacy‚Ä¶

Source: Google Research
Author: Unknown
Category: technical_deep_dives

item.title: Enabling physician-centered oversight for AMIE
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
Introducing guardrailed-AMIE (g-AMIE), a new AI diagnostic tool designed for history-taking in healthcare. ü©∫ g-AMIE operates under strict guidelines, preventing it from giving personalized medical advice. Instead, it generates summaries for physicians to review, ensuring patient safety and oversight. This system allows primary care physicians to maintain accountability while leveraging AI for efficiency. The recent study demonstrated g-AMIE‚Äôs performance being preferred over nurse‚Ä¶

Source: Google Research
